security: This memo identifies individuals as 'fellow travelers,' 'communists,' or 'Marxist-Leninist,' based on information from a CIA source. Disclosing these labels could jeopardize the safety and reputations of those individuals and potentially expose CIA sources and methods. Quoting directly: 'Tischman identified the following students as 'fellow travelers''.
summary: An FBI memo dated September 3, 1963, relays information from a CIA source in Madrid regarding American students who traveled to Cuba, identifying them by their alleged political leanings.
summary_one_paragraph: On September 3, 1963, S.J. Papich of the FBI sent a memo to D.J. Brennan relaying information received from a CIA liaison regarding American students who had recently visited Cuba. The CIA source in Madrid, Spain, contacted Mark Tischman, one of the students, who identified several others as 'fellow travelers' and labeled others with terms such as 'communist in ideology,' 'Marxist-Leninist tendencies,' and 'Trotskyite.' The memo directs this information to the Internal Security and Nationalities Intelligence Sections for further action.
title: Permanent Student Committee For Travel to Cuba
